Container.Name: poste
Container.Category: Cloud: Productivity: Tools:Utilities Network:Web Network:Other Network:Messenger
Container.Overview: [p][span style="color: #777;"]FREE version of Poste.io, full mail server solution. POP3, SMTP, IMAP, Spamassassin, WebMail, WebAdmin. [br/] INITIAL SETUP:[br/][br/] 0. Requires registered FQDN to send/receive external email.[br/] 1. Following ports are used by container for mail: 25, 110, 143, 443, 465, 587, 993, 995[br/] 2. Following ports are used by container for webui: 80, 8280 (These may conflict, check your ports)[br/] 3. Make a user share for mail data, default is /mnt/user/poste[br/] 4. Some or all mail ports may need to be opened, forwarded, or dmz for mail send/receive to work.[br/] Optional arguments[br/] -e "HTTPS=OFF" To disable all redirects to encrypted HTTP, its useful when you are using some kind of reverse proxy (place this argument before image name!)[br/][br/] NOTE: Marked as BETA, simply because author is not an expert in email exchange servers -- software itself looks pretty good.[/span][/p]

Config.Name: HTTPS
Config.Description: This should be left as OFF if using reverse proxy

Config.Name: External Sieve Filter Manager
Config.Description: When you are going to use clients with ability to manage Sieve filters externally, you need also publish port 4190

Config.Name: PUID
Config.Description: UID for permissions. Do not change unless you know what you're doing.

Config.Name: PGID
Config.Description: GID for permissions. Do not change unless you know what you're doing.
